senses.de: Happening without a clear pattern, purpose, or plan.
senses.ex: Random people were selected for the survey.

Tips.title: Lack of Control
Tips.description: Random events can't be predicted or influenced by anyone.
Tips.example: The weather is so random lately.

Tips.title: Unexpected Occurrence
Tips.description: When something random happens, it's surprising and not anticipated.
Tips.example: A random thunderstorm ruined our picnic.

Tips.title: No Discrimination
Tips.description: Random selection means everyone has an equal chance.
Tips.example: The draw for the prize was random.

senses.de: Made, done, or happening without method or conscious decision.

Tips.title: Without Thinking
Tips.description: A random decision is made quickly, without careful reasoning.
Tips.example: He made a random choice and surprisingly won.

Tips.title: Impulsive Action
Tips.description: Random acts often result from a sudden impulse rather than a plan.
Tips.example: She bought a plane ticket to Paris on a random impulse.

senses.de: Unknown, unidentified or chosen at random.
senses.ex: She received a call from some random person.

Tips.title: No Personal Connection
Tips.description: A random person is someone you don't know or have a connection with.
Tips.example: A random man on the street asked me for directions.

Tips.title: Feeling of Unpredictability
Tips.description: Calling someone 'random' can express the unexpected nature of an encounter.
Tips.example: She keeps getting texts from some random number.

senses.de: In computing, selected without any defined method or pattern.
senses.ex: The computer generated a random number.

Tips.title: Strictly Technical
Tips.description: In computing, 'random' is precise and relates to unpredictability in algorithms.
Tips.example: The function returns a random integer each time it's called.

Tips.title: Not Truly Random
Tips.description: Computers simulate randomness; it's not truly unpredictable like natural randomness.
Tips.example: Random number generators are essential in cryptography.

Arbitrary.wordDefinition:
Arbitrary means something that is decided or chosen without any specific reason or principle, whereas the word random means something that is chosen or happening without any particular pattern or purpose.

Random is applicable when referring to something that is unpredictable, chance or lacking in order or purpose, while arbitrary is applicable when referring to something that is subject to personal choice or whim rather than any rational basis.

Capricious.wordDefinition:
Capricious refers to something or someone that behaves in an unpredictable, impulsive, and often erratic manner. It implies a tendency to change one's mind suddenly or to act on a whim without any apparent reason.

Example: The weather is capricious and can change quickly from sunny to stormy without warning.

Capricious refers to behavior that is unpredictable and impulsive, while random refers to events or processes that are not based on any discernible pattern or order.

Casual.wordDefinition:
Casual means relaxed or informal, while the word random means without a particular aim or pattern.

Casual is applicable when describing something that is not formal or serious, such as casual clothing or a casual conversation.

Chance.wordDefinition:
Chance means that there is a possibility of something happening or not happening based on circumstances or conditions. For example, there is a chance of rain today.

In other words, chance relates to the likelihood of an event happening based on certain conditions or circumstances, while random refers to events happening with no predictable pattern or reason.

Both words can be applicable in various scenarios such as games of chance, statistical analysis, and decision-making processes.

Erratic.wordDefinition:
Erratic refers to something that is unpredictable or inconsistent in its pattern or behavior. For example, an erratic driver might swerve unexpectedly, making it difficult for others on the road to anticipate their movements.

Both words describe things that are unpredictable, but erratic implies an element of variability or inconsistency in a behavior, while random implies a lack of deliberate order or purpose.

Haphazard.wordDefinition:
Haphazard implies a lack of organization or planning, often resulting in a messy or chaotic situation. It suggests that things are done without a clear purpose or direction.

In other words, haphazard implies a lack of intent or strategy, while random implies a lack of pattern or predictability.

For example, if someone throws clothes into their closet haphazardly, it suggests that the clothes are disorganized and not arranged purposefully.

Indiscriminate.wordDefinition:
Indiscriminate means without any thought or care about who or what is affected.

For example, indiscriminate bombing is when bombs are dropped without considering who or what may be in the area, causing damage and harm to innocent people.

Predict.wordDefinition:
Predict means to make an educated guess or estimate about what will happen in the future based on available information or past experiences.

For example, a meteorologist predicts that it will rain tomorrow based on data collected from weather satellites.

Predict is used when you can make a reasonable guess based on gathered information or past experience, while random is used when the outcome is not determined by any specific plan or pattern.

Unplanned.wordDefinition:
Random and unplanned are similar in that they both describe things that happen unexpectedly or without deliberate intention.

However, random suggests that there is no particular pattern or reason behind the occurrence, while unplanned implies that there was an original plan, but it was not followed or something happened to interfere with it.

An unplanned event could be missing a flight due to traffic - there was a plan to get to the airport on time, but unforeseen circumstances caused it to fall through.

Random is used more to describe things that happen without any apparent logic or order, while unplanned describes situations where something was supposed to happen a certain way, but ended up deviating from the plan.

quotes.Text: I think a lot of people who maybe know me from one video or come upon me randomly think I'm stuck-up because I'm blonde, or the way I come off, or from something I might have said. But everybody who actually knows me knows that I'm very down-to-earth and super chill.
quotes.Title: Canadian Celebrity
quotes.Name: Gigi Gorgeous

quotes.Text: I miss people. I miss going anywhere and meeting a random person and saying 'Hi' and having a conversation about life. I love people.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Lady Gaga

quotes.Text: We can all fight against loneliness by engaging in random acts of kindness.
quotes.Title: Scottish Writer
quotes.Name: Gail Honeyman

quotes.Text: For as long as I can remember, I was always creating random characters.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Lucas Cruikshank

quotes.Text: I believe life is an intelligent thing: that things aren't random.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Steve Jobs

quotes.Text: So much of life, it seems to me, is determined by pure randomness.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Sidney Poitier

quotes.Text: Sometimes in life, random things can blind-side you.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Michelle Ryan

quotes.Text: Random chance plays a huge part in everybody's life.
quotes.Title: American Inventor
quotes.Name: Gary Gygax

quotes.Text: My life was a sort of series of random disasters.
quotes.Title: English Author
quotes.Name: Claire Tomalin

quotes.Text: Maybe life is random, but I doubt it.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Steven Tyler
